intro: Eupatorium rhodopodum, commonly known as the Greek thoroughwort, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It features erect, branched stems that are often hairy, and it produces clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are opposite and often have a slightly rough texture. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or limestone habitats. Eupatorium rhodopodum is known for its medicinal properties and has been traditionally used in herbal remedies.
